Transmission of the Dharma, Bestowed with Purple Robes, Subject Shi Hu, Respectfully Translated by Imperial Decree I take refuge in the Lord of the Silent Ones of the three times, who proclaims the true words of dependent origination;
If one understands that all phenomena are apart from dependent origination, the practice of the conditioned phenomena is also like this.
Apart from the two extremes of existence and non-existence, the wise have nothing to rely on;
The profound has no object, and the meaning of dependent origination is established.
If one says that phenomena are without nature, then various faults arise;
The wise should contemplate in accordance with principle that phenomena have nature.
If there is a truly attained nature, like the discriminations of the foolish,
Then without nature there would be no cause, and how could the meaning of liberation be established?
One cannot say there is nature, nor can one say there is no nature;
Understanding that nature is without nature, the great wisdom speaks in accordance with principle.
Nirvana and birth and death, do not view them as having separate natures;ğŸ”½Nirvana and birth and death, the two natures have no difference.
Birth and death and nirvana, both are non-existent;
If one understands birth and death, this is precisely nirvana.
Destroying the nature of birth, discriminating cessation is also thus;
Like an illusory created thing, cessation appears without reality.
If cessation has something destroyed, knowing that it is conditioned;
In the present Dharma, there is still no attainment, how can one know the destroyed Dharma?
Those aggregates do not cease, afflictions exhausted is precisely nirvana;
If one understands the nature of cessation, then one attains liberation.
If the Dharma of birth and the Dharma of cessation, both are unobtainable;
Correct wisdom observes, arising from the conditions of ignorance.
If one sees the Dharma as tranquil, all activities are also thus;
Knowing this supreme Dharma, one attains boundless Dharma wisdom.
The nature of dependent origination can be seen, this meaning is not without seeing;
In this, the subtle nature is not the discrimination of dependent origination.
The Buddha's right enlightenment says there is no saying without a cause;
If one exhausts the source of afflictions, one breaks the characteristics of samsara.
The definite practice of all dharmas, seeing existence, making, and grasping;
How are the limits of the past and future established from conditions?
How is it that what has already arisen in the past later transforms again?
Therefore, the limits of the past and future are like the world seen in an illusion.
How can an illusion be produced?
How can there be attachment?
The deluded, within the illusion, seek the illusion as real.
The past limit is not the future limit, because of grasping views one does not abandon;
Wisdom observes nature and non-nature, like an illusion, a mirage, a reflection.
If you say that arising is not ceasing, it is the discrimination of conditioned phenomena;
And that wheel of dependent origination turns without anything appearing.
If already arisen or not yet arisen, their intrinsic nature is non-arising;
If the intrinsic nature is non-arising, how can the name arising be obtained?
Because of quiescence, phenomena are exhausted, but this exhaustion cannot be obtained;
If the intrinsic nature is inexhaustible, how can the name exhaustion be established?
There are no phenomena that can arise, and no phenomena that can cease;
Those two paths of arising and ceasing appear according to events and meanings.
Knowing arising is knowing ceasing, knowing ceasing is knowing impermanence;
If the nature of impermanence is known, the depths of phenomena cannot be obtained.
Phenomena arise from conditions, although arising they are apart from ceasing;
Like one who reaches the other shore immediately sees the affairs of the great ocean.
If one's own mind is not understood, ordinary beings grasp at the nature of self;
The inversion of existence and non-existence gives rise to all faults.
All dharmas are impermanent, suffering, empty, and without self;
Herein, seeing the separation of dharmas, wisdom observes existence and non-existence.
Without abiding, without objects, without roots, and not established;
Born from the seeds of ignorance, free from beginning, middle, and end.
The great evil city of darkness, like a plantain tree without substance,
Like a gandharva city, all seen as illusions in the world.
In this realm, the Brahma King first, the Buddha speaks the truth as it is;
Later, the sages are without falsehood, and their speech is also without distinction.
The world is darkened by delusion, with the characteristics of love flowing and turning;
The wise understand all loves, and speak well of equality.
First, it is said that dharmas exist, seeking the true nature within existence;
Later, seeking the nature is also non-existent, then it is free from attachment and nature.
If one does not know the meaning of separation, following what one hears one will have attachments;
And the meritorious deeds one has done will be destroyed by the foolish and ignorant.
As explained before, those karmic actions are truly real;
If one understands their intrinsic nature, this is said to be non-arising.
What I have explained is all based on the Buddha's teachings;
As it is proclaimed, it is the dharmas of the aggregates, sense bases, and elements,
The great elements and so forth, and consciousness, all explained as equal;
When that wisdom is directly realized, there is no delusion, no discrimination.
If this one thing is as it is in reality, the Buddha has said it is nirvÄá¹‡a.
This is supreme and without delusion; without wisdom is discrimination.
If the mind is distracted, it provides an opportunity for the mÄras.
If one is truly free from faults, this is precisely non-arising;
Thus, dependent origination is explained by the Buddha for the world.
If there is no discrimination in the world, how can this be non-arising?
If ignorance can be extinguished, after extinction it is not arising;
Arising and ceasing are contradictory names, without wisdom one gives rise to discrimination.
If there is a cause, then there is arising; without conditions, then there is no abiding;
If apart from conditions there is a nature, how can this existence be obtained?
If there is a nature that can be grasped, then arising and abiding are spoken of;
Herein there are many doubts, namely that there is a dharma that can abide.
If bodhi can be realized, then it is constantly spoken of everywhere;
If abiding in a nature can be grasped, then this is said to have arising again.
If it is said that dharmas have reality, the ignorant make this statement;
If it is said that dharmas have a place, grasping is also unobtainable.
Dharmas are without arising and without self, wisdom enters into true reality;
The characteristics of permanence, impermanence, and so forth, all arise from the mind giving rise to views.
If you establish multiple natures, you will achieve the true nature of desire;
How can this not always give rise to faults?
If you establish a single nature, the desired is like the moon in water;
Not real, not unreal, all arise from the mind's views.
The dharmas of greed and hatred are extremely heavy, arising from views and grasping,
Causing disputes and arguments, establishing reality apart from nature.
Those causes give rise to various views, and from views, afflictions arise;
If one correctly understands this, views and afflictions will both be extinguished.
One should know that dharmas are impermanent, appearing because of conditions;
Conditioned arising is also unarisen, this is the supreme true word.
Sentient beings' wrong and deluded wisdom, unreal yet conceiving of it as real;
Arising in disputes with others, their own practice turns upside down.
Their own part cannot be established, how can there be another part?
Wisdom understands without dispute.
If there is a slight dharma to rely on, afflictions are like poisonous snakes;
If there is no stillness and no movement, the mind has nothing to rely on.
Afflictions are like poisonous snakes, giving rise to extremely grave faults;
Covered by the poison of afflictions, how can one see the various minds?
Like a fool seeing a reflection, they mistakenly give rise to the thought of reality;
The bonds of the world are also like this, wisdom is entangled by delusion.
Nature is likened to a reflection, not the realm of the wisdom eye;
Great wisdom is originally unborn, with subtle conceptual objects.
Attachment to form is considered ordinary beings, detachment is the lesser sages;
Understanding the intrinsic nature of form is the supreme wisdom.
If one is attached to all good dharmas, it is like being free from the inversion of craving;
It is like seeing an illusory person after, seeking the essence of what was created.
Knowing this meaning is a loss, do not observe nature and non-nature;
Afflictions cannot be attained, the light of nature destroys false wisdom.
Wisdom is free from defilement and pure, and there is also no purity to rely on;
If there is reliance, there is defilement, and that purity will give rise to faults again.
The extremely evil dharmas of afflictions, if seen as inherently free,
Then the mind is without agitation, and one attains to cross the ocean of birth and death.
This sweet dew of good dharmas arises from great compassion;
Relying on the TathÄgata's words, there is no limited discrimination.
Herein, it is difficult to speak like this, but according to the wise one's view, it is accomplished;
The wise one observes according to the gate of following, and like this, all arise from great compassion.
In the true nature of all dharmas, the wise one observes according to principle as appropriate;
The direction is thereby able to give rise to faith and liberate sentient beings from all suffering.
This meaning is very profound and vast, I praise and explain it for the sake of benefits,
As the words of great wisdom have now been proclaimed, it can destroy the darkness of delusion of self and others.
Having destroyed the afflictions of darkness and delusion, as it is, one can avoid the obstacles of Mara,
And thus be able to open the door to the good destinies, what is lost in the affairs of liberation?
One who upholds pure precepts will be reborn in the heavens, this is the definitive true statement;
Even if one who breaks precepts abides with a correct mind, although one's precepts are destroyed, one's views are not.
The growth of seeds is not without meaning, seeing the meaning and benefit, one acts extensively;
Not taking great compassion as the right cause, how can the wise give rise to the desire for the Dharma?
